climbs.name: Whoa Nellie it's off to the Deli
climbs.fa: Donna Rockwood, Craig Rockwood, Paul & Paks White May 2006

content.description: Bolted face climbing. Rappel or walk off left. You can rappel with a 60m rope from the anchor of And Mono Cone Too if you don't mind not finishing the route, but will need a longer rope (probably 80m) to rappel the whole thing.
content.location: currently farthest left bolted climb on the South Face

content.description:
This East Side classic was first climbed by Vern Clevenger and Tom Higgins in 1975. It was climbed in the traditional runout style. Alan Hirahara added bolts to this route, but it is rumored that they have been chopped.

P1: From the base of the cliff, climb scary moves off some blocks and onto this beautiful slab. 115' leads to a two-bolt belay.

P2: A 5.8 pitch continues to another two-bolt belay.

P3: One more 5.9 pitch leads to another two-bolt anchor.

To descend, either rappel or walk off to the left.

climbs.name: And Mono Cone Too
climbs.fa: Donna Rockwood, Craig Rockwood, Paul & Paks White May 2006 (GU)

content.description: Jugs lead to an arete. Can rappel/lower off with a 60m rope, since you'll end up on higher ground from the start of the route.
content.protection: 7 bolts to 2-bolt anchor with chains and quick links
content.location: Second bolted line from the left on the South Face. Look for the arete after the 3rd bolt.
